message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE

Reasoning: 
1. cs.CL (Computation and Language) - The paper deals with word embeddings, which is a common topic in natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the purview of cs.CL.
2. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - The paper proposes a new method for learning word embeddings, which involves training a model to map words to Gaussian distributions. This falls under the domain of machine learning and hence, cs.LG is a likely sub-category.
3. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) - Word embeddings are widely used in various AI applications such as text classification, sentiment analysis, and machine translation. Hence, cs.AI is another likely sub-category.
4. cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) - Although the paper does not explicitly deal with computer vision, Gaussian embeddings have been used in image processing and computer vision tasks. Hence, cs.CV is a possible sub-category.
5. cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) - The paper proposes a neural network-based approach for learning Gaussian embeddings. Hence, cs.NE is another possible sub-category.
